Waking up in the hospital after James's attack, the only person Bella wanted was Edward but how do you find someone who does not even exist?

The night of Halloween is rumoured to be the one time of the year where the veil between the dead and the living is the thinnest. For Marcus Volturi it is, like any other night of the year, a night of mourning. One-Shot
Halloween season calls for pumpkin patches, costumes, and trick-or-treating. Nessie has an interesting costume choice and a wish to have her grandparents, Esme and Carlisle accompany her.

One year after Breaking Dawn. Bella, Edward, and their family get a taste of Caius' payback and Bella's faced with something that will either make her stronger or that will forever tear her apart. AU/OOC/OC/HEA (Originally posted over ten years ago newly revised)

Bella, an artist who had sold her soul to big business to keep food on her table and a roof over her head, has a huge crush on Edward Cullen, a game developer, at the company where they both work, but she's too shy to do anything about it until her friend Alice convinces her to buy a pair of skinny jeans. Will true love find its way?

AU. Bella never dove off the cliff by herself in New Moon. Her and Jake ended up together. Things were good. Until the day Jacob imprinted. Jacob Black was not supposed to imprint. Ever. That is what he firmly believed. Because if he was supposed to, it would have been on his girlfriend, Bella Swan. So, he shut down the imprint at a cost. To who though? Surely just himself?

So this is a one shot about what Bella may have done to come to terms with Edward leaving in New Moon. This is from a real life experience and how hard it is to come to terms with people leaving. This may upset some viewers. ONE-SHOT

Autumn left La Push in hopes of a new start on life. Four years later she is back and with a new life growing inside her. As she struggles with new adjustments, life throws one more curveball at her and lets her run into Embry.
Leah considers her future and makes a decision.

When Carlisle finds Esme's body in the morgue that fateful night in 1921, there was no doubt of what he wanted to do. However, many thoughts plagued his mind the moments leading to her transformation.

Bella and Alice both get sick and end up taking a trip to the hospital at the insistence of Bella's brother Emmett. But the two doctors taking care of them might make this hospital stay a little bit more bearable. All Human
Bella is pretending to be sick and Carlisle wants to know why. All Human, Bella is a child.

Edward is a fifth grade safety patrol. Bella and Jacob are fourth graders. When Jacob decides to challenge Bella to a race to the bus stop, Bella's clumsiness gets her caught. Just a silly idea I had one time, imagining the characters as children. Best friends Bella and Jacob and Bella has a childhood crush on Edward. ALL HUMAN

Just a small dribble of what would have happened if while killing Victoria, Jacob was also there. And there he realized that he had lost his war. The story is still the same, just a small change. Give it a try.

[ABANDONED] Everyone is living a happy life until the Volturi arrive, and Edward can't hear their thoughts. Then, Jacob gets hurt so badly, not even his accelerated healing can save him. The only choice is to change him. Will he survive, even though the vampire venom is like poison? Will Edward and Bella defeat the Volturi once again?

Post Breaking Dawn. The Cullen's (and Jacob) have relocated to Vancouver. Another half-vampire might be the one answer to the one thing that Rosalie has ever wanted. And the one thing that Emmett has ever wanted was to give Rosalie her happy ending. Though even immortality is never that simple. AU.
This is a very cute and mostly lighthearted AU in which María and Leah are together and Leah wishes to learn Español to understand her girlfriend better. Touched by this, María decides to teach her.
...but then she had smiled up at him, and swept him off his feet in the current.
Edward wonders if it's a good thing that he can listen to his biology partner's thoughts. Oneshot. Slice of life. "If I Were Bella Swan Challenge".

Meadow Black is quiet, blunt, and protective of those closest to her. Nonsense isn't in her vocabulary. All her life, she was overlooked, but once life takes a turn, she refuses to remain voiceless. When the infamous, hot-headed Paul LaHote starts vying for her attention, she doesn't know what to do. She doesn't want to deal with his persistence and his determination to talk to he
This is a re-write of the latter part of Eclipse to make it more Jacob friendly. AU of course.
What if Bella convinced Edward to stay in New Moon? What if Edward never left Bella. One-shot. Completed.
Maria proposes a fun, interesting little game for Jasper. A/N: This is a two part fic that will be separated into two pages with María’s pov during the first part and Jasper’s pov during the second.

Vampires and shifters aren't the only supernatural creatures out there. Emme Wildes comes from a long, distinguished line of witches. After her mother is banished, she elects to move in with her estranged aunts and fully commit to learning magic. Unfortunately for her, she has a lot to learn, and a coven of vampires certainly aren't making things easy. (Twilight with Witch!Bella)

Guest list for the wedding of the year for Forks, WA, includes a certain cousin sister. Its not Edward's cousin, neither the Cullen clan. No, this cousin is a Swan. Lets see how she handles Bella's drama. Some refence to Suits TV Series in it too. Warning: includes swearing

Told from Edward's point of view, this story takes place during Edward's pursuit of Victoria after leaving Bella at the beginning of New Moon. When his hunt entangles him with a human girl, the two find themselves as allies with a mysterious connection, forced to wrestle with their belief in souls, love, the value of life, and inner demons as they fight to keep each other alive.

"Vampires, werewolves, and now time travel? How many more mythical things from my childhood storybooks are real?" A necklace given to her for her birthday holds a strange power that takes Esme on an emotional nostalgia trip through her past. A Carlisle/Esme story. Post BD. TW: Esme's abuse and suicide included. Lemons and fluffy occasionally if you're into that.
Bella wants to meet Renée and Edward wants to go there to escape Bella from Victoria. A missing piece, when Bella and Edward go to Jacksonville to meet Renée.
We all in know how Bella and Edward's relationship developed during their course, but let's see how they were while Bella was in the hospital, broken and in recovery. Edward point of view.
Please take the time to read and vote for your favorite entry :)

Bella is now starting her new life in England with Carlisle. Emmett reflects on his choices good and bad. Emmett's P.O.V Pt 6 of Celebrations. Carlisle/Bella DISCLAIMER: Twilight and its characters belong to S. Meyer. Otherwise, the rest is my musings on an AU.

What if things had been just a bit different? What if Carlisle had never started the Cullen family? One-shots of each of the characters from the moment of divergence from the 'real' timeline, and how they were all reunited, in the end.
After an intimate wedding and reception, Carlisle and Esme have their first dance. One-shot.

Isabella Uley had been a simple girl with a simple life who was a hundred percent sure of two things. First she loved her brother Sam and her mother with all she had and second she loved to hate Paul Lahote even more than that but then again what is life without a few twist and turns?
Bella is unfairly cruel to our chubby bunny. The family is there, but Jasper most of all.
Rachel Black returns home to student teach at La Push HS. Embry falls head over heels.
It's not so wise if you try to run.
One-shot based on a prompt using the song The Way I Do by Bishop Briggs. One-sided.

The newborn vampire battle is over, Victoria is past and the Jacob chapter is over too. Edward plans to surprise Bella with a getaway, bit he himself gets surprised when he finds himself in his hometown Chicago. Now in Epov.
"Bells this behavior is not normal. You need to move on Kiddo." The line that completely changed her life and put her in the path of the shy boy who sat across from her in the library.

This is a one shot based on what it could have been if Bella and Carlisle had mated instead of Bella and Edward. It starts by explaining from the beginning of each persons story and goes up through to Bella's almost accident with Tyler Crowely's van at school that lands her at the hospital when she first meets Carlisle.
Rochester in 1933, a young, beautiful and optimistic Rosalie meets a mysterious Bella. Everything that ensues is the collateral damage. Part one of a three part series.

When a very human girl decides to live with her father, nobody expected the results! She gets pulled into a world that has no right showing itself to her, unfortunately, some think themselves above the laws of supernatural's and men alike! DISCLAIMER: Twilight and its characters belong to S. Meyer. Otherwise, the rest is my musings on an AU.

When Natalie transfers to a new college in Forks, Washington, her mother warns her not to go. There are dark secrets shrouding the little town... dark secrets that Natalie has no business uncovering. A short, sweet, fluffy romance featuring the wolves, and OC.
looking for Bella Jasper story will remove once found story

Analeigh Hale roars into Forks on a secret mission, but ends up finding family, love and and maybe a place to finally call home when someone from her past makes her question everything. **Story takes place after New Moon. Felix backstory is changed as is the timeline for Paul and Rachel getting together.

The Twilight Saga with a twist of magic. Bella is a witch from what the magical world considers royal bloodlines. After a tragic loss, Bella is taking charge of her life. Returning to Forks to start her senior year at Forks High School, where she meets Edward Cullen, her Mate. Together they will tackle mysteries, experience jaw-dropping revelations, and a lot of action ExB AU OO

I am looking for a Bella story I think she is with jasper. it takes place in braking down. just after she marriage Edward and begins to see that she was tricked. I remember a part in it where after Edward goes hunting she takes his card and passport and tosses them into the see.

Her eyes had been touched by Death himself as she'd always muse and his cloak of concealment would be brought up with a smug drawl. Two new Vampires with a past of assassination join the Cullens but death seems to follows where ever they go but this time it's not of there doing.

"What nourishes me also destroys me." - Latin Proverb. Forced to live the first few years of her vampire life under devastating circumstances, finally breaking free at the cost of someone she loved, Cate is finally starting to heal with her brother Phil Dwyer and his family, until she and her new stepsister Bella Swan move to Forks and meet a golden-eyed coven.

Post-BD. A moment or conversation that might have happened between Jacob and Bella at some point after BD was finished had his imprint/feelings been similar to Leah/Sam/Emily in the books. Completed one shot. Reposted.

Shame, it was what I felt since we had saved Bella's life. Shame for having betrayed my family's beliefs and letting my nature dominate me. How was I going to be able to face Bella and my family again? One-shot about Edward's feelings after the battle with James that lead him to discover a family secret.
Bella missed the first three days of her daughter's life, and is determined to make up for lost time. Fluffy one-shot. AU. Review! :)

A prequel to my Stepping from Shadows world, this is the story of Gray's first experience living amongst humans as a nearly two-year-old vampire. Set in the summer of 1920, while still finding her way in her new world, she and Carlisle travel to Tennessee to witness the decisive battle in the seventy-year long fight for full suffrage for American women.
All you need to know is on the chapter. I really need your help guys... It's been a while since I'm searching and found nothing :/
At six years old, I had my first Thankgiving.

After losing her family, Lauren takes over raising a young boy. With hopes of getting them both out of crime-riddled Detroit, she instills in him the values of kindness and doing the right thing. However, sometimes, doing the right thing comes at a price. Unsung Heros contest second place

Jules lived her whole life as a police dog only to be retired and forced to spend her life at home while her master, Garrett, continues to be a cop with a new dog. But does she really stay at home? Unsung Heros Contest winner
What do you do when your girl freezes on stage? Do you help her or watch her fall apart?
Rosalie hates Seth... of course she does. Rosalie/Seth {light angst} - oneshot -
When Bella accepts a babysitting job from the new family in town, what she expects, isn't what she gets.

After getting hit by a car, 24 year old Katie now finds herself inhabiting the body of 17 year old Jessica Stanley from the Twilight Series. Katie has found herself in senior year before New Moon takes place. Is she dead, or how will she go home? Why can't Edward read her thoughts and help her? Katie's journey will offer her a new prospective on the books she loved as a teen.

Emmett ended up in a plane crash while on a business trip to Hong Kong several years prior. Now stranded on an island by himself, he sees himself as the president and king. But is everything as it seems?

I watch the love of my life fall apart. I can't do anything about it. While I am the most powerful man in the Tribe, I can't be there for her. Loosely based on the song Someday by Nickelback. A series of love letters over several years. For the sake of this story Jacob and Bella were born months, not years apart. Commander In Chief Contest Winner Of The Foreign Affairs Award.

As we all know, Rob is the new Batman. So, in honor of his achievement, we're having a Twilight Fanfiction Crime Crusaders Contest. When stories are received, they will be posted here. In the meantime, come join our FB page at /groups/364646141068423/ Let's all go batty it'll be fun.

Rosalie knew something about her had changed. But when she woke, she wanted not blood, but vengeance. She wants to rip apart those who destroyed her — those who stole what was most dear to her. Only then will she allow herself to be a part of a family she never knew she needed.
At six years old, I had my first Thanksgiving.

Christina Swan is the eldest daughter of Charlie and Renee. When her parents divorced she stayed with her father. Her mother taking her little sister Bella. Now years later Bella is coming back home to the lovely town Forks, Washington. What troubles will come with this ? Her boyfriend of two years suddenly losing grip on his temper, her sister sudden changes for her new boyfriend.

For someone so tiny as you were, it's amazing to think the impact you had. You changed my course. Bella writes a letter to her lost, unborn child in the aftermath of a tragedy. A 'what if' scenario if Bella had decided a different choice regarding her pregnancy. Warning: This story deals with the aftermath of an abortion.

The Vietnam War is in full swing, but Bella Swan is on the right path. Perfect friends, perfect school, perfect boyfriend. This is everything she should want, so why isn't she happy? Everything changes when she's saved by a beautiful, mysterious boy, the kind she shouldn't talk to. The kind she shouldn't want. Then why is he the only one who loves her for who she really is?

After the heart-breaking events of the previous months, the last thing Bella needs is a midnight injury and more awful nightmares. But with Bella's luck, anything is possible and it's all thanks to her wonderful vampire father, Carlisle, that she is able to fully recover from the events of the last few months. Bella and Carlisle bonding as Bella learns to open up to Carlisle.

Edward hasn't spoken to Bella for two years now. A few harmless pranks are played. But what happens when she disappears without a trace and Edward finds her diary? Who is this Mr. Crabs and is he hurting Bella?
One late night call changes everything.
This story is set in New Moon. When Edward abandons Bella, she is scarred forever. What if his family realizes their mistake and returns home to pick up the pieces?

Edward Cullen wasn't able to resist the sweet scent of Bella's blood. He forgot, though, about the new security system the school had installed. The new camera security system. With the only rule of the vampire world so blatantly, and irreversibly, broken, what will the Volturi do? The Quileutes? The vampires and humans of the world as a whole?

Jacob Black is a sophomore secretly in love with a senior. She's gorgeous, fiery and passionate, and she just got dumped by her boyfriend, Sam. Even though in her world, Jacob technically doesn't exist; at Leah Clearwater's darkest moment, he's there to help. All he has to do is keep his cool. One Shot. AU. Blackwater.

Sequel to my story Preciosa. Maisie has survived Maria, but how will her new life in Alaska treat her? Jasper is searching for answers, Gunner is adjusting to dating a werewolf, and Edward is guiding Jasmine through the newborn phase of her vampire life. [COMPLETE].

The Hikawa sisters are Daughters of the Moon, Quiluete priestess of ancient times, chosen to protect an ancient secret. A curse hangs heavy between La Push and Forks, looming over the woods like a fog. They must stop it from coming to past, or face the war and carnage it brings upon their world.

Having a kid is supposed to one of the most amazing things that ever happened to someone. At least that's what I always thought. I didn't even know how I got here. My mother is Esme Cullen wife of Dr. Carlisle Cullen. I was born a little while after my mother was turned into a vampire. I know it's supposed to be impossible. I have five adoptive siblings and a lot of problems

Chasing visions, like trying to catch your own reflection - Alice has been hunting for years, but time is running out to find her future. And when she does, what then? A summer night and a knife edge, a choice between eternity and fire. [Alice/Jasper, AU]

I can't remember the name of a story I read like a year or more ago. It involved Jacob and Nessie's son (who had a really unique name that I think began with an "O" or "S") falling in love with a human. Please contact me if you know the fic!
Continuation of Tides of Change. Caprice and Bella Swan are in for heart break, thing will change, growth and anger will win out. We all know they return but is everything as they left it?
Carlisle and Esme take Renesmee on summer night date to the fair and the movies.
Mike Newton catches a train.

A short story and the final epilogue to the Sunrise Saga. Renesmee and Jacob are preparing for the wedding of their daughter, Sarah, and the entire family is coming to Forks from all parts of the globe to meet up for the joyful occasion. Find out what happened to everyone 23 years after the final battle in Eternal Dawn. Takes place in 2041.
Unfortunately for Bella, she can't unsee what she repeatedly sees.

How do you choose the next rising star of the literary world? For the leader of The Twilight Order it all comes down to how a book makes him feel. He'll find that the words have nothing on the woman who wrote them.

Bella goes into the woods, to die by Victoria. But first Bella going to talk to Victoria. Then we will see if by the end of the talk if Victoria will kill her or not. to live or not to live. this my first story, so sorry for any grammar error. can you guy leave a comment on the story and tell me if you like or not. and why.

I watch the love of my life fall apart. I can't do anything about it. While I am the most powerful man in the Tribe, I can't be there for her. Loosely based on the song Someday by Nickelback. A series of love letters over several years. For the sake of this story Jacob and Bella were born months, not years apart.

Two people – both left behind by the ones they loved. The story of an unusual imprinting, that no one understands. Does love have the power to make two people who had completely given up on life turn a new leaf and can they heal each other's wounds.

Takes place 4 years after Breaking Dawn. Nessie looks 15. When Jake imprinted, he assumed everything was going to be perfect between them but their lives together are still a struggle - the Cullens are moving to NH, there's growing competition between him and Nahuel, who visits Nessie every year for her birthday, & eventual danger from Joham. Read Orbiting Satellites Bk 1 before 2

When the delicate balance between worlds comes under threat, the Volturi seek out Beau for a task only he can do—but even the most perfect of loves can be a double-edged sword, and the Volturi's greatest enemy may turn out to be someone Beau has never known to fight. [The final installment of the Reimagined series.]

Alice and Jasper adopted a daughter, Lataine. One day, Lataine is having trouble with her asthma so Jasper calls her Uncle Edward, a family doctor, to come over and check on her. Mostly fluffy story but does feature medical needles. All Human.
Graduation is approaching Bella must choose between Edyth and Julie. all the while Victoria is planning her revenge. And Bella has one last choice to make life or death. But which is which?

(Be It Feb, Mar Or May) As Carlisle & Bella grow steadily closer to leaving for their forever. Esme gets 4 chances to reflect on her mistakes. Esme's P.O.V Pt 4 of Celebrations. Carlisle/Bella DISCLAIMER: Twilight and its characters belong to S. Meyer. Otherwise, the rest is my musings on an AU.
When Bella accepts a babysitting job from the new family in town, what she expects isn't what she gets.
She wanted nothing but freedom. !ONE-SHOT!
This is a novelization of the Twilight episode of Tablepop by dorkly on Youtube. RPG stands for Role Playing Game. During lunch at Forks High School, a monster attacks.
Ghost AU. Most people aren't haunted. At least, not like this. Rosalie/Bella. Complete.
Even in immortality, he knew death was inevitable—at least until one of the most powerful vampires in the world singles him out for a new purpose. [A Reimagined story.]

Why do I need him like a human needs air to breathe? Why do I feel so restless when he is not around me? The rational part of my brain argues that he is my sister's boyfriend and it is wrong to have such thoughts about him but my heart disagrees and says that he is mine like I am his. And my life has become a constant struggle between heart and brain.

Isabella must accept the truth that her husband was lost in battle during World War II. Time has moved on, but each day she is forced to take a step further from the man she promised to wait for. The same man that was there for her during her darkest times, was now asking her to wait for him in his own dark days.
He was going to change her. Make her something she hadn't been before... She might hate him for it, but she would be alive. That was enough for him. Drabble/AU
The Cullen's celebrate Easter much like any other family, Easter Sunday Mass, Easter baskets, egg hunts, and everything in-between with a young Nessie.
How tough can it really be to take down a grizzly? Emmett takes Bree on a bear hunt.

For Bella Swan, life was changed for ever after she met Edyth Cullen. But being in love with a vampire is even more dangerous than Bella could ever have imagined. Edyth has already rescued Bella from the clutches of one evil vampire, but now, as their daring relationship threatens all that is near and dear to them, they realize their troubles may be just beginning…
One growing hybrid. Two immortal widowers. Three historic days. Part of Kairos, an Edward/Carlisle Breaking Dawn AU.
It's Bella's birthday and Jacob is making sure she gets the best birthday present ever. (A cute little one-shot I randomly thought up.)

Starving himself for a while not feeding because of his depression from a bad loss in battle, Jasper loses his sanity and enters a state of animalistic ferocity. Jasper comes down from his feral state only to see a badly injured Maria.

From the moment he meant her, he knew she was something beautiful and spectacular. He watch as she gracefully glided down the spiral staircase and immediately he felt his heart filled with pride. That gorgeous angel was actually his wife. /A first glimpse in the events taken place before and after Edward and Bella wedding with Carlisle and Esme.
"I remember sounds like that from my childhood, laughter from no cause, simply because the world is beautiful, something like that" - Louise Gluck, from Vita Nova

When Edward left Bella in the forest during New Moon, what if he had done so with something else influencing his decisions? What if he hurt Bella so badly that the Wolves were forced to resort to a legend that may not have worked? What if the reason Edward left Bella was due to something so rare, it was almost undocumented in the Vampire world? This is what we explore in Bloodmoon.
She's been alone for so long... can she allow herself to get caught back up with the family that brought her into this world, when they left her behind the first time.
It's strange what desire will make foolish people do. *Angela outtakes from The Give Away Girl* A birthday gift for Iris. *COMPLETE*
A horrible birthday getaway crosses the path of Bella and her green-eyed nurse. A story about friendship, hope and love. AH.

A young, blonde, blue-eyed boy once roamed between these pews. He slept in this room, he wandered these gardens, and served at this altar. For the first time since he was turned, over three hundred and fifty years ago, Carlisle steps foot in the church that raised him, his beliefs, and the morals that he's carried with him for centuries. Fluff and a little lemons with C/Es included
What good were eighty years of death and destruction and suffering if he can't protect her? Alice is bitten during the battle in Eclipse.

How far would we go for our family? For our sibling? Follow Evangeline Swan as she journeys through the minefields of family, friends, love, and the hazards of dealing with immortals. Eventual Felix x OC.

Something strange and wonderful happens to Jacob and Renesmee during the Volturi Confrontation that will create a bond between them that might be stronger than the imprint. They must learn to deal with new abilities, prepare against possible Volturi retaliation, traverse their evolving feelings for one another, and learn how to be a real family. This is their story starting BD

Song fic two-shot based on two Billie Eilish songs called "listen before i go" and "i love you" Set in New Moon when Bella goes "cliff diving." Suicide themes. AlicexBella, Bellice. Sad fic, please read and review.

Emmett, while completely comfortable with his sexuality, has not been as lucky with the continual foster families he's been placed in. In a new home with the Cullens, he finds himself heavily attracted to the mysterious youngest sibling. But is everything as it seems?

Emmett knows the meaning of pain but carries forward because the world continues spinning and life keeps going even after pain and suffering have taken it's tole. Even after tragedy is all you know. Because beauty can be found on any given day. And on some of those days, the future can be found too.

Set during Eclipse. Instead of being evil, Riley never meets Victoria. Instead, he was turned into a vampire ad he met Ella. Ella and him have been together for 2 years. Ella is a human. They moved to Forks, Washington and have lived happily as neighbors to the Cullens. Riley follows the Cullens' diet. Ella is pregnant but gets attacked by Victoria. Will she and the baby survive?
Carlisle and Edward learn that Esme can play the violin.

Carlisle and Esme have the responsibility of being parents to seven teenage vampires and one hybrid. Carlisle has a fun night ahead of them to leave all that behind and just act their physical age, even for a little while.
Carlisle and Esme walk through the church Carlisle grew up in.
I used to write a twilight fanfiction or two from 2009 to 2012. Am I back? You tell me.
Carlisle and Emmett having a talk in preparation for Emmett's wedding night.
The first time Esme was able to pick out her own clothes
Esme absolves Carlisle's guilt for changing her without her consent.
Human lives can be traumatic, the emotional scars from one's past do not heal over and disappear with the help of venom as physical scars do.
What happens if Charlie had found out what Bella is? I do not own any of these characters

In 1921 Esme believed she lost her baby boy, and jumped off that cliff that brought her to her family. However, what if Esme had twins- a boy and a girl. She's alive and is furiously lookin for her mother.
Young Nessie is going to be starting school soon, with Esme and Carlisle playing the role of her parents. However she is conflicted on what to call them from here on out.

A missing piece of what happened while Edward and Bella were on flight back to Forks. We know what went through Bella's head, but what about Edward. Come and read what were the thoughts running through Edward's mind all the way.
But I think, maybe, there is some validity in accepting that a part of you went with the person who died, and a part of them stays with you always. A story about Carlisle, Esme, and the afterlife.

Renesmee has three grandparents in her life, Esme, Carlisle, and Charlie. However, she finally gets to meet her Grandma Renee. However she is feeling quite conflicted on whether or not she's going to like her. Companion piece to "Love You Always"
Carlisle comes home tense due to having to make a difficult decision that he knows would affect Esme. How would she take it, considering how much she longed to have had her baby live.
Mortal AU - Percy opened up a bakery right between Hecate's Haze, a magic shop, and Eye of Nemesis, a tattoo parlor. The shops' owners are a very cute, married couple. Ethan/Alabaster/Percy slash

Leo Valdez is tired of it. HIs friends leave him out of everything. SO then one day, when they are hanging out and he made a 'yo mama' joke, Annabeth snapped. Leo slips away, and starts hurting himself. Piper follows, and he admits everything. He never wants to see them again, but then one day they come up to his new place in Camp Jupiter...
Death. it calls me. But Will is my light.

A collection of letters from the PJO universe. One last chance for some of the characters who were lost to explain, ask forgiveness, and say goodbye. Rated T just to be safe, since people die in PJO. Luke Castellan, Silena Beauregard, Zoë Nightshade, Charles Beckendorf, and Captain Emily Zhang. Also some father-son bonding for Nico di Angelo and Hades.

Percy Jackson leaves Atlantis with his father to visit Olympus as the Winter Solstice of 2005 is about to begin. Annabeth Chase is excited to visit Olympus and meet her mother. Luke Castellan's bag seems to be heavy, the Big Three are angry, and Ares is cranky. The storm clouds are beginning to darken the sky, and they will not leave for a while. More info inside.

no one every relised she was down there all alone. No one knew her story. No one cared Untillshe finally communicated with someone. She doesn't like the curse she doesn't want to see the future anymore. just read it is a one shot if you want to try and take it over i am not opposed

its what the title says rated T just to be safe but it might not be. disclamer: i do not own any of the chracters in this only my OCs. the characters belong to the amazing uncle rick. Please read and review!

Annabeth had seen it all in those short years and had worked with all of them. She had been in Shanghai and then in Greece two days later. Annabeth had crossed paths with famous makeup artists and incredible photographers of the fashion industry. But what she has not seen yet, was the magic model Percy Jackson did on the runway... (Make-up artist!Annabeth and model!Percy).
When Annabeth spends the night, she sneaks Percy back into bed from the living room couch and finds out just how much her boyfriend hates thunderstorms. Oneshot.
A soldier lost to time is quite literally dug up and returned to Camp Half Blood, causing a massive headache for Will Solace.
Even though someone you love is gone, their love will still be with you.

The side characters of a story are neve really in the focus, even though they make up the story. the main characters are the bricks but the side characters are the cement . So in this fanfiction, you will see interviews with ONLY the side characters. Because they deserve the attention too. PJO INTERVIEWS.

what if the demigods had YouTube channels? What would the content be? What would the name be? Read to find out. The chapters are meant to be short. they also aren't real chapters, just the info. Like channel name, etc. PJO YOUTUBE!
One day after the Giant War, Percy decides to something about his tattoo. Read the story to find out how Annabeth responds

"This is so wrong, I can't believe we're doing this." "I don't give a damn." "Me neither." In which Percy and Annabeth no longer fight for each other, but still need each other. A toxic Percabeth story.

This story is set after the war with Gaea. Clarisse is ready to try living in the mortal world with Chris, but before she does that she needs to pick a new Head Counselor. He knew. Ever since he had stared into those captivating electric-blue eyes, he knew his heart was now in her hands forever. But how far would he have to go for her to return those feelings, that is, if she ever did?

In retrospect, hosting Christmas dinner at their new home in Half-Blood Village while she was heavily pregnant, at almost 31 weeks, maybe hadn't been Annabeth's best idea but she had always dreamed of having her loved ones in her home, laughing and enjoying the celebrations. When all of Camp Half-Blood, and most of all Annabeth, turn their backs on Percy and shun him for something he hasn't done, he and his half brother leave for Olympus. This is a collection of one-shots and drabbles written in response to the prompts/challenges posted at the Camp Jupiter-War Games! Forum.

Knock knock. No answer. Knock knock knock. Still no answer. So light em up up up, light em up up up, light em up up up, I'm on fire "Yo, Queen!" "Mind opening the goddamn door, Valdez? I'm knocking like a maniac out here!"

So, I'm pissed off. Then it occurred to me to write about what I pissed off at. Then I realized that Hazel is black and living in 21st century USA. Obviously, she's had experiences with racism. Futurefic, about a decade or so after the Giant war. Canonverse. Disclaimer: I'm female and I am not a writing genius/troll. Therefore I'm not Uncle Rick. T for mild language.

Asta is the daughter of an Easterling King and Queen who follow Sauron. When she was left for dead Gandalf found her and asked her to join him in Rivendell to join the fellowship to destroy the ring. Seeing that she is an Easterling is there any way that the other members of the fellowship get past the idea of her being who she is? Boromir/OC Book 1 of Easterling Princess

Under Strange Stars is Glorfindel's story, and the Lord of the Golden Flower certainly enjoys telling all about his dangerous journey into the blazing deserts of Far Harad in search of Elrond's missing son. A riveting tale for sure, but every story has two sides. Today we tell Elrohir's. Part of the Under Strange Stars series.
Another random thing I wrote at 12am, this time about Legolas and Aragorn just sitting up at night. Might make a series of these.
In which Elrond meets Celebrían. (Part 2 of Burn the book that says you took the Autumn) (Bookshop AU)

In which Elrond reflects. Or: A character study of Elrond Peredhel, after he returns from war overseas, but before he meets the young florist next door. (Part 1 of Burn the book that says you took the Autumn) (Bookshop AU) (TW: self-harm)

Elves are immortal but can be slain. Legolas's younger sister Alasse is seriously injured after an Orc battle. She is grievously wounded. Aragorn and his other friends are there for support, but Legolas is very shaken, afraid that his little sister may die! Lots of angst and friendship!
A young Estel persuades Legolas to let him sleep in the elf's bed chambers. The prince realizes why his friend is so reluctant to go to bed, and does his best to comfort Estel after a nightmare.

Taking place years after Frodo had failed to destroy the ring, evil is rising in Mirkwood again. Elrond and Thranduil have to fight side by side, not without consequences for the relationship between wood- and high elves... T-rated version of my story "A Night of fulfilled Desires".

Legolas is injured, and the only herb Aragorn and the twins can find to dull his pain is one that will make him high. The prince starts to reveal things about his and Aragorn's bedroom activities that the man would much rather be kept private. The twins are delighted with such excellent teasing material, and egg Legolas on, much to Aragorn's dismay.

Legolas despairs that his home will never be restored to its former glory, that Greenwood will forever be Mirkwood. After the prince is sent to Imladris to recover his spirits, Aragorn is put in charge of his best friend's care. Forcing Legolas to give himself a break once in a while is no easy task, but Aragorn is determined to see to it no matter what it takes.

Legolas feels cursed. He cannot escape from the emotional hole he fell into when his best friend (OC) was killed two years ago. On top of that, he has now been captured by orcs and is likely fated to the same death as that friend. With no hope of escape, can this curse turn into a blessing? (Not AU! Complete!)

Oneshot: Many songs would be sung of the Battle of Helm's Deep. Of the Deeping Wall, the Hornburg. Of the Last Ride of the Rohirrim, and the coming of the White Wizard. None however, would remember what had transpired within the Glittering Caves. Of valour without renown, and blood feeding steel.

During an Orc hunt, Aragorn, Legolas, Gimli, and Legolas's younger sister Alasse are ambushed. In the midst of the swarming struggle, Legolas is captured and taken away by the Orcs! Alasse is beside herself with worry for her big brother, but Aragorn promises her they'll save him, though he is riddled with guilt and worry for his best friend. Will Legolas live? Will he be saved?

Thranduil struggles to come to terms with all the Silvan elves that are lost against the darkness. He struggles with how to make sure they matter, how they will always matter. How everything they did helped to drag him day by day closer to the end. Dates, names, sacrifice's made, and thing loved most about them. This is how they're remembered.

Aragorn comes down with a minor human illness that is no true danger to him. It's Legolas' attempts to cheer him up that he needs to worry about. The prince's good intentions cause no small amount of chaos in Imladris, and Elrond starts to wonder if he needs to put his son under armed guard before things escalate.
A random one shot I wrote at like 12am about Aragorn, but could be read as Boromir I guess, admiring Legolas late at night out in the forest.

The anniversary of the death of Legolas' mother falls during the Fellowship's time in Helm's Deep - a fortress of stone, the last place a wood elf should be when they're grieving. Aragorn is determined to comfort his best friend, and does what he can to support Legolas through the difficult time.
Éowyn and Éomer talk of their parents. Written for the Teitho "Legends" theme, where it tied for second.
Eomer's daughter decides a legendary tale needs a happier ending.
please read this short informational, LOTR fans will love the variety of content that will likely fall in line with their interests!

*!REVISED!* Lies. Treachey. Deciet. Men's hatred for the King of Mirkwood peaks after he failed to aid them in the slaying of Smaug. Thranduil struggles to decide who he can trust, while being cornered by unknown persons in his own home! Will the King manage to come out on top with his people behind him? or will it end in bloodshed? Cover not mine! Pre-Hobbit 50 years.

Oneshot: "It is but a shadow and a thought that you love. I cannot give you what you seek." Such were the words that had spurred Éowyn to ride to the Pelennor Fields. Such were the words that lingered in her mind in the dead of night.

"Gimli hadn't actually been sure if Legolas had ever, or could ever be in a bad mood. Since departing Rivendell he had witnessed the elf's smile and bright nature survive thunderstorms, hunger, heartache, and once even a deep slashing gouge across his stomach. But for some reason, this minor head wound and a shoulder injury had gotten the best of him? It didn't make sense."
Elladan and Elrohir take pity on Aragorn's doomed attempts to seduce Legolas. The twins do little better with the oblivious prince, and much confusion ensues.
It may be concealed for centuries, but eventually truth must out - no matter how much damage it does along the way.

Winter has passed and it's time for Malorn to head to Imladris and learn about himself under the care of Lord Elrond. He wants to heal his heart but the demons of his past continue to haunt him even in the peaceful elven realm. Can he find the courage to mend his spirit or will he be broken again. AU. Rating is just to be safe. Sequel to "To Heal a Broken Heart". Please review!

Aragorn is sure Elrond is going go kill him for falling in love with his daughter. In a desperate effort to protect his life, he enlists the help of Legolas and the twins to keep their relationship secret. It turns out Elrond knows more than they thought he did, and his reaction is completely unexpected. Aragorn/Arwen pairing, but this is mainly a Legolas/Aragorn friendship story.

When Saruman claims the Ring and declares himself the Third Dark Lord, Gandalf can only see hope in the form of an old friend of his... and a certain Elvenking. Be warned, this features an extremely evil, ruthless Saruman

Alasse, Thranduil's daughter and Legolas's sister. She enjoys being the princess of Mirkwood, but longs to be more than just a pretty face. Legolas is her hero, and teaches her how to fight. They are best friends. Thranduil wants her to be a proper princess, waiting for a suitor. She believes in Legolas. He's very protective of her and woe be to any who dare hurt his little sister!
One quiet evening after the battle of Pelennor Fields, Legolas' elven glow starts to fade. Aragorn knows just what to do to help his friend.

Aragorn is horrified when Legolas jumps in front of an arrow to save him, nearly dying in the process. He insists that his life for the life of an immortal isn't a fair trade, but Legolas won't listen to him. Elrond and the twins find way to help both friends move forward. OOC Aragorn and Legolas.
Haldir learns that when it comes down to it, it's just a game. No matter how much it makes you want to rage-quit your playable character off every cliff side and building imaginable.

Mirkwood is in a panic. Their only prince is missing, presumed dead, and they are losing hope. As time runs short for Legolas, Aragorn is determined to do anything to find his friend, even if that means enlisting the aid of the unsuspecting assassin who did the crime.

Three years after the quest ended, and Frodo didn't seem to be feeling any better. In fact, it looked to Sam like he was doing worse. What makes the former Ringbearer's life after the quest bearable? A mix of bookverse & movieverse.
When a small boy gets sick, tall tales are the best entertainment. Written for the Teitho Contest Picture Challenge IV, where it placed first.
A young one sees the light of the modern world for the first time.

After touching the Palantir for the first time, Aragorn is haunted by the experience struggles to expel Sauron's presence from his mind. While Gandalf works on helping Pippin, Legolas takes Aragorn to the forest and shows his friend how to let nature help heal him.

Aragorn discovers that sometimes losing a treasured possession can feel almost like losing a dear friend. When something very special to him is lost in a fire, Legolas finds a way to console him. Aragorn/Arwen pairing, but this is mainly a Legolas/Aragorn friendship story.
Faramir is searching for the seal of his office.

After being chased by a pack of Orcs, a group of Rangers decides the best (and only) course of action is to run headlong into Mirkwood with only Aragorn's word that the elves won't let them die in there. Somehow, Aragorn is both correct and incorrect about his promise at the same times.
Based on the scene in Return of the King where Frodo and Sam were with Merry, Pippin, Gandalf, Legolas and Gimli. Just a little drabble!
Frodo has enough problems with Narrators, including when they mess with his new television set and the lights! Oh no! Theme: Frustration.
To show his appreciation for his mother, Primula Brandybuck-Baggins, Frodo has a special surprise for her. Happy Mother's Day! Theme: Motherhood.
After first breakfast, Frodo Baggins leaves Bag End for his morning stroll, unaware of how beautiful nature can be in the Shire. Theme: Nature as Beauty.
While working on his book, Frodo is transported from Bag End to a cave, where he meets his fangirls for the first time. Theme: Tolerance.
Even separated as they were, they all had to eat. Had to rest. Had to laugh.

The night before his coronation, Aragorn is plagued by doubts over whether he can be a good king to Gondor. Legolas, Elladan and Elrohir do their best to reassure him, and many years later, Aragorn returns the favor.
Frodo's thoughts as the Fellowship escape Moria.

Pippin and Merry have An Idea. They are assisted by Elladan and Elrohir, who have A Better Idea. Aragorn and Faramir nearly start a civil war. Legolas and Gimli and Gandalf cause general trouble. Frodo and Sam are of course involved. For MistressOfImladris - hopefully this is how you think of Elladan and Elrohir. ;D
During his travels in Harad, Aragorn encounters a seer.

After Legolas' mother dies, Thranduil fears his son will succumb to his grief. He sends Legolas to Imladris, where the prince meets Elrond's youngest son. Little Estel helps Legolas start to heal and move past his pain. OOC Legolas.
Call them Woses, Wild Men, Drúedain… It was their forest. Then the Mother came. A tale of the Drughu in Second Age Middle-earth.
They sail for Valinor, but the Valar do not approve.
Alone for the first time, Legolas struggles with guilt as he realizes his does not miss home or Thranduil. But does he?
An injury causes Legolas to lose his memory. While the physical damage may heal, the prince's recollections may never return. Aragorn is unsure if he'll ever truly have his best friend back.

After Gandalf's death, once the Fellowship makes its way safely to Lothlorien, Aragorn and Legolas must find a way to grieve for him. Together, the two friends find a way to move forward past their pain.
Three separate moments revolving around Legolas' voice. (Mute!Legolas, belongs to 'The Strength of Silence' series)
Denethor learns that his friend will not return from his victory over Umbar.
Our intrepid ranger meets a Very Hungry Cater- err, Cave Troll while traipsing through Moria. Aragorn puts his diplomacy skills to use. The cave troll cries. For Cuthalion97!
Denethor and his sons play correspondence chess.

'Go north. Find the Dúnedain. There is a young Ranger amongst them, you should meet him. His father Arathorn was a good man. His son might grow to be a great one.' With no other goal to pursue, and desperately in need of a purpose Legolas had taken his father's advice and headed northwards.

Unede Arinyaelen, a warrior, a hero of Mirkwood, and light of her people, has never been one for love. For a thousand years she has sacrificed for the citizens of Mirkwood on the battle field, and now she sits on the council of the King. Met with matters of the heart, and political strife, Unede must navigate her way through uncharted territory, and learn who she is meant to be.
When Aragorn dies, Legolas is sure it is the end of everything. Only when Gimli drags him Valinor does he discover that perhaps his friend isn't gone after all. OOC Legolas.

When Thranduil dies, Legolas sends a desperate plea for Aragorn to come to Greenwood. Aragorn knows that he's the only one who can comfort his friend, the only one Legolas will truly show his pain to. OOC Legolas.
A grief too great for words.
Gollum has retrieved his precious but it won't last long. Pure crack fic! Final part of 'Taking the Hobbits to Isengard' series.
Two Rangers, on the Road.
A farmer worries about the market tax he will have to pay with the return of the king.
Aragorn is injured and Legolas is convinced it's his fault. His worry for his friend won't let him sleep, and Aragorn does his best to help. OOC Legolas.
A Haradrim lord decides to visit the Tark king in an attempt to plead for his son's life.

Denethor decides, now that the war has ended and he is free of Sauron's control, that it is time to mend his broken friendship with Gil. It is something which he knows he should have done a long time ago.
Ecthelion has decided to hire sellswords. Not everyone is happy with the decision.
The Ring has been destroyed, yet Barad-dûr still stands. Saruman goes inside to search for anything Sauron may have left that will tell him how to make a Ring of his own.
An Easterling healer receives patients after the battle of the Pelennor field and learns how the battle went.
Did claiming the Ring at Mount Doom make Frodo less of a hero?
It may not have been Galadriel's idea to gift Sam with a box of earth before the Fellowship left Lórien... and there may have been more than one reason to do it.

In the rose-filled valley of Imloth Melui, a young girl named Ioreth dreams of someday becoming a healer. But being a healer doesn't necessarily mean you have to live in the Houses of Healing, at least not at first.
In Lothlórien, Legolas tells Aragorn of his love for him, but Aragorn loves Arwen and considers Legolas only a friend. My response to all the slash about the two of them.
Aragorn reflects on the losses at the Battle of Helms Deep, especially the Elf Prince Haldir, and ponders what the future might hold.

How does the Valar of Death feel when Lord Elrond and King Thranduil mourn their wives? Does he do something about it? Does he hate that they do not comfort their children? Yes and yes! Rated T in case I descide to change anythin
This is another snippet set in my fourth ring AU. I am trying out a Legomance. Estel has a question for Alfirin.
After the trials of Moria the fellowship take two days to travel to Lothlórien. That night blame lays heavy on the heart of some. A one shot story.
"Always worrying," Boromir says, and then he laughs. That sound is more than ringing trumpets, more than banners in the breeze, more than the running of fresh water. [Faramir and Boromir and fate.]
A cheeky Legolas gets his own way when his Nana can no longer be bothered to argue against his elfling logic. One Shot based off a prompt.
It is a stormy night in Mirkwood and Thranduil the king of wood and stone gets an unexpected visitor. -This story is also published on my Ao3 account.
Elladan challenges Legolas to preform in the Hall of Fire, and the woodland prince has never been one for backing down from challenges. (Lightly edited)
When word reached Rivendell that Frodo was abroad and Gandalf was missing, it was Glorfindel's lot to take the road, and Eluréd and Elurín's to ride south.
The decision to go to war is never undertaken lightly. In the first year of the third age a princess of Mirkwood awaits the return of the woodland army.
Faramir stops before the Hall of Stewards on an errand in Rath Dínen.
A pair of young Fallohides go hunting for hollyhock, and have an alarming encounter.
What was Faramir's reaction when Aragorn asked Faramir to be his right hand man and prince of Ithilien?

Elrohir's odyssey across Middle-earth finally brings him home to Rivendell. Sadly all is not well: the Elf-child that was abducted into Umbar is now a Man grown. Forty years of war and darkness left Elrohir deeply scarred, and the Hidden Valley harbors ancient conflicts of its own. Part 3 of the Under Strange Stars series, can be read on its own. Story now complete!
Ioreth's cousin writes to her.

Quinn Fleming never expected to become a warrior of any kind, or to find a family in this strange new world. But now the stakes are higher than they've ever been before, and she will have to fight with everything she has to save the people she loves. [SEQUEL to Playing the Hero]
After a long and dull day Pippin tries something new for a change.
Ficlet about Aragorn meeting the boy and the man Boromir. Beware the feels.

Rebuilding a war-ravaged world begins immediately after victory at the Black Gates. Heroes and soldiers become Kings, Princes and administrators as they build families, societies and legacies in a changed, more peaceful world. A collection of Post-ROTK one-shots starting with "Triage" where, before all the work begins, Legolas first has to look after himself and find his friends.
He was unsure at first of what to make of her. A slip of a girl, really, barely out of the nursery. Or: In which Lothiriel is sassy and Eomer is definitely into her (and he should stop denying it)

When Thranduil arrives a day early, Elrond is convinced he's going to have to awkwardly flounder through conversation until Celebrian and the twins return. Thankfully, at least, the unexpected presence of Legolas brings out a softer side in his father
A year after The War of the Ring, Gimli visits Moria one last time to fulfil one important task.
Legolas is traveling from Mirkwood to Rivendell when he meets Aragorn for the first time.

After King Elessar gave up his life, Legolas prepared to follow at last the desire of his heart. But there was one more journey he had to make before sailing across the Sundering Sea. There was one last member of the fellowship left on middle-earth besides himself. Legolas could not leave without seeing a certain elderly dwarf and asking him one question...
Faramir faces an ordeal.

Cycle 146 279. Can Cycle, LotR. It was the battle against the Dark Lord Morgoth and his lieutenant Sauron. There would be only war. Unfortunately (or fortunately) someone didn't get the memo. Result: Many dropped jaws and a dead Dark Lord.

AU. No Character Death. We all know how the fellowship ends... or do we? Legolas takes Aragorn to see the ship he and Gimli have built to leave for the havens... but he's got a happy secret that Aragorn is about to discover; something the King had thought impossible. For anyone who has ever cried their eyes out over the way the appendixes ended the fellowship. :o)
In which Faramir learns more about the things Boromir has left behind.
The Three Hunters rest; Aragorn reflects. Two Towers standalone
Conversations between close friends, Legolas and Aragorn throughout the Fellowship of the Ring. A healthy mix of angst, worry, comfort, laughter, and some warm fuzzy feelings.

After a disastrous encounter with orcs, Legolas, Aragorn, and the twins take cover in a marsh. However, this is only the beginning of their troubles and all too soon one of them enters into a battle for their life.

When Legolas' intended day off drinking his favourite Dorwinion is interrupted for an important mission he is determined that he is sober enough for the task. Crown Commander Aglardaer is somewhat sceptical and a little mischievous.
An al fresco romantic interlude for Aragorn and Arwen.
On the way to Helms Deep, Aragorn dreams of Arwen. One-shot.

A one-shot based on a line from Appendix A in Return of the King that reminded me of Daniel 1:1-5 in the Bible. "...and the kings in Harad did homage to Gondor, and their sons lived as hostages in the court of its king."
These are a series of one-shots that I submitted to a LotR contest on Wattpad. They begin at the coronation of Aragorn and continue into the Fourth Age, based on the stories by Silverhand19.
When the world gives you relentless rain, you find the deepest puddle you can find, and jump in it. Young-Legolas

Legolas is taken from Ithilien by slavers and forced to become an arena fighter. King Elessar, wrapped up in peace negotiations with Harad, doesn't even know he's missing. In a dark and brutal world Legolas finds one small spot of hope when he befriends a little human slave child. But nothing is what it seems...
Aragorn plants the new White Tree

Loena, Horse-Mistress of the Riddermark, is the heir to a destitute familial tie. The line of Baldor had been great once, and celebrated, but after generations of neglect, had fallen into nothingness. As the dark grows, and the power of Orthanc strengthens, Loena joins of the quest of the Ring for the sake of her name, and to protect land she so loves. No MS, 10th Walker

Oneshot: It was in the east of Arda where the race of Men arose with the coming of the sun. It was in the east of Arda where they might come home...if not for thousands of years of mistrust between their peoples.

"Then why do these black horses endure such riders? All other animals are terrified when they draw near, even the elf-horse of Glorfindel," Frodo said, and Gandalf replied, "Because these horses are born and bred to the service of Mordor." So, how do you train these horses? And what happens afterward? A story of hope and healing. Now in 3 parts, b/c that format made more sense.

Eldarion fears that he will never live up to his father's great legacy. So: he sets off on a treasure hunt that will surely impress King Elessar and prove he can be a hero, too. But all of young Eldarion's plans quickly go awry when he gets lost in the sewers of Minas Tirith.
What! It couldn't be, could she? No, just no! He was going mad, talking to himself. (Otherwise known as observing Éomer's denial, a cross with Much Ado About Nothing.)
Vignette. My slightly extended and appended version of part of the Coronation scene near the end of ROTK. Decidedly Aragorn & Legolas centric.
One after one, everybody he cares about is ripped away. With seemingly only one left, Elrond makes a desperate plea.

The Ring War has been won, the Third Age has come to an end and Elrond must accept that it is his time to leave at last. As he comes to terms with the uncertainty of what might await him and the enormity of what he leaves behind, his seneschal comes to a realisation of his own…

To escape royal duties and wedding preparations, Aragorn, Legolas and Arwen go on a little side-trip in Gondor. Part of the Cave Story Trio. Other stories in the Trio are: - It had to be Caves by Cassia - It had to be Stairs by Siobhan

To escape royal duties and wedding preparations, Aragorn, Legolas and Arwen go on a little side-trip in Gondor. Part of the Cave Story Trio. Other stories in the Trio are: - It had to be Caves by Cassia - Down and Up Again: The Elves and Ranger's Holiday by Katie (not officially part of the Chronicles)

To escape royal duties and wedding preparations, Aragorn, Legolas and Arwen go on a little side-trip in Gondor. Part of the Cave Story Trio. Other stories in the Trio are: - It had to be Stairs by Siobhan - Down and Up Again: The Elves and Ranger's Holiday by Katie (not officially part of the Chronicles but I am including it)
Something is worrying Estel, and Gilraen is determined to find out what. Fluffy oneshot.

The loss of Mirkwood's queen shocked the whole forest into grief. In the aftermath, Thranduil and Legolas have been drifting apart, but it's nothing a stubborn tree can't fix. After all, Thranduil knows Legolas is just as much the forest's son as his. Pre-series, inspired by Jedi Sapphire's amazing work. I don't own the Lord of the Rings. R&R!
A day in a rather confusing market place goes a little bit askew for the elf and ranger. Humor. Vignette.

Denethor calls Faramir 'A Wizard's pupil,' but not much is known about the relationship between Faramir and Gandalf. Here is my take on a relationship that is overlooked, and how Faramir came to earn that title.
AU, another path to the rimgs destruction.
An AU where soulmates can hear more of each other's thoughts the closer they come to bonding. Aragorn talks to Arwen and chases after the love of his life.

There was a tumblr post about Legolas pretending to have weak bones so he doesn't have to carry stuff. Aragorn finds out and counters Legolas' bullshit with his own -namely a large stack of pans and a fat grin on his face. Crack, Gen, Friendship, Fellowship shenanigans.

While walking through the forest of Ithilien with Aragorn, Legolas notices that there is something bothering his friend. Can the elf help Aragorn realise that somethings cannot be explained and must be felt with the heart?
His arrow is not enough. [Legolas, Helm's Deep.]
Why did Grima throw the Palantir from Orthanc?
Éowyn tells her friends the story of a valiant woman from long ago. (Or, the story of Haleth from the Silmarillion as told by Rohirrim of the Third Age.) Gen, referenced character death.

The Witch King is very curious about the beings that have twice evaded and thwarted him. He wants to know who they are... especially the human. When he is poisoned, Aragorn's only hope of survival is to follow the Wraith's summons to Angmar, where the antidote lies. To stay with him now, Legolas must choose to walk willingly into the arms of the darkness that has once held him.

Daycare. It's a place that most people fear a little and the wise fear a lot. But two of Tolkien's characters are so intent on speaking to their fanfiction writer that they foolishly dare to enter the deadly arena. Will they survive the day? Guys, this may be the most realistic fanfiction story I've ever written. It's long, but I think it reads pretty quickly.
One Yule evening, Frodo makes a wish on a shooting star. He's surprised when it comes true, as much as he loves his parents. It is one Yule he won't forget. Merry Christmas, 2018! :)

All is not well in Imladris: a very young Elrohir has disappeared. After decades he is found in the Far South of Middle-Earth. Can Glorfindel rescue the House of Earendil once more? His task is not an easy one: Elrohir has no memory of who he was, and little interest in leaving his people's fight against the Black Nùmenoreans of Umbar.

Aragorn is caught in a blizzard with Legolas' best friend Aeglosson. The two aren't keen on each other nor on having to share an enclosed space. Snark, arguments and confessions ensue in their attempt to wait out the storm and stay warm.
A haiku for Eowyn

Seeking shelter from a storm, the fellowship takes advantage of a nearby heated spring - and are stunned to find to find that their elven companion is not as 'perfect' as they all thought and expect him to be. Early Fellowship.
Thranduil unwittingly finds himself alone for Yuletide for the first time in many centuries. He reflects and remembers.
The last days of Sauron, the Witch-king and Khamul from their point of view.
A companion piece to "And Every Winter Change To Spring" told from Éomer's point of view.

In a new world, old friends meet, but baggage from the past will shatter their peace and destroy their harmony. The future, perhaps, does not bode well for Aragorn and Legolas. Sequel to Beware the Starless Midnight and Even the Birds are Chained to the Sky
After the Council of Elrond, Legolas introduces himself to Bilbo... with surprising results.
Éomer asks for Lothíriel's hand in marriage. Lothíriel is not sure what to say.
A year after Sauron's defeat Éomer King meets the Princess of Dol Amroth on a sunny March morning, in a garden by the sea.
Gandalf wants nothing more in Middle Earth than to confess his feelings to Galadriel—with the help of a love potion, there is no way she can refuse him. Crack. Just pure crack.
A reluctant sailing trip, a timely seastorm and a deserted beach. Enter the fruit.
Nothing, nothing would compare to the pain of finding one's beloved... only to lose them, before their time. A Poem

Aragorn and Legolas wanted only to heal after their harrowing experiences in the south. But fate has other plans. Evil has always haunted the Barrow Downs near the Shire, but now strange things have been happening and many are saying that the wights have awoken to haunt the countryside. Aragorn and Legolas, along with Aragorn's brothers, must ascertain to the truth.
One-Shot: Eowyn has a hard time putting her feelings into words. Fluff.
A masquerade ball proves to be an educational experience for Lothiriel and Eomer.
Captain Thorongil has a problem
Merry and Pippin after they get home. Its and idea that popped in my head, I know its kinda crappy

The One Ring has been found, the Fellowship has departed for Mount Doom – and Ardhoniel of Imladris can hide no longer. Forced to face her troubles and herself, she has to decide once and for all. To hold on to the past or to let go. To be brave. To live. Continues where The Lost Years left off. Mix of the books, movies, and some OCness.

After Estel finds out about his destiny, Legolas' visit is rather unwelcome. Did his friend know and not tell him? Little one-shot I wrote up at 1 am. Friendship and light banter later. Hurt!Legolas because he always is honestly. No slash, gen. T for swearing.

Fifteen years is a long time... a long time in which Aragorn and Legolas have not seen one another. When Legolas is accused of being a traitor to Gondor there are some who would like Aragorn to think that things have changed more than he realizes. Embroiled in a strange mesh of deception and intrigue Legolas' one chance may rest with his old friend... And who has betrayed Gondor?
The Uruks' plan of taking the hobbits to Isengard does not go very well. Pure crack fic! Part 3 of 'Taking the Hobbits to Isengard' series.

Frodo has a terrible fear of dogs. To ease his fear, and get him to like dogs again, his cousin Pippin comes up with a most brilliant idea: to attend a dog show in our world on Thanksgiving Day. It leads to the most interesting results for Frodo Baggins and Pippin Took. Happy Thanksgiving, 2018! :D

Aragorn is having disturbing dreams about his friend Legolas. When he sees the prince's death in the Mirror of Galadriel he sets out to try change the future. Yet it seems that fate, a ring of horse thieves and deadly venom are determined to conspire against Legolas before his friend can reach him. Even with Elrond's help, will Aragorn be able to keep his visions from coming true?

Aragorn lost his memory in Harad. It returned, but not all of it returned at once. The healing mind is a funny thing. So when he finds himself somewhere strange, in an unthinkable situation, what is he supposed to think? Where is he? What's happening? How can he set it right?
Oropher and Legolas meet for the first time in Valinor; and it doesn't go very well at first.
Legolas has to say goodbye to a longtime friend.
Deep in a Dol Guldur dungeon, Celebrimbor must hold his silence to ensure his greatest work stays free. For the Teitho Challenge: Honour. Rated T for the strong subject matter.
Faramir becomes obsessed with some strange stories from the North.

Time passes much more quickly for Elves than for mortals, and sensing that his dear friend's life is approaching its end Legolas is reluctant to part from him. Even to attend a festival and see Gandalf's fireworks. (Chapter Three has been edited and fixed from the first posting because it cut off the last 8 or so lines. I don't know why.)
It's not easy being Lord of the Valley. For even if he has bad days, he can't show it. Thankfully, there is at least one understanding soul left in Rivendell.

When Aragorn falls in love with Arwen, it seems that he has done the one thing that divides him and his elven family. Certain that his home is his no longer, Aragorn leaves with the rangers, to forget the heartache of all he has lost... What he didn't count on was losing his memory and forgetting *everything*. Now, to find him, Legolas must join the very men which captured him.

A generation apart, two adventures become one. While wintering in Mirkwood, Aragorn is taken captive by a bounty hunter with a mysterious objective, leaving Legolas, Elrond, Elladan and Elrohir in a struggle to save the human before its too late. 80 years later, Aragorn is King of Gondor, but the shadows of the past don't lie quietly and he, Legolas and Gimli face another struggle.
The battle of helm's deep goes ill for one of the fellowship, will they survive, or will they succumb to their physical and mental wounds
The woman Éomer has wed is brittle, but not hard—cold, but not frozen. A romance in four drabbles.
After departing the Golden Wood, Galadriel and Celeborn rest for a time in Imladris, where Celeborn reveals the doom that has laid heavy on his heart for some time, much to Galadriel's discontent.
Humorous vignette. Legolas has a very bad morning and drags his friend Aragorn into it.

After a long absence, Legolas is returning to Mirkwood. But what will he and Aragorn find when they get there? Trouble more severe than either of them could have ever guessed is stirring in the Wood-elves realm and treachery beyond imagining. The result may be more than either the elf or the ranger can handle... and if they can't, then not only they, but all of mirkwood will suffer

Stranded in the wildness with no supplies and an injured friend, Aragorn has nowhere to turn except for a couple of strangers. But what if they aren't everything they seem? Can Legolas and Aragorn really trust them?

Ever since the Fourth Age, I have continued to exist. So has she, but she doesn't remember me until it's too late. Now, we're in the modern age, and still, she doesn't remember us from past eras. Maybe this time will be different.

Frodo shares deep interactions and reflections with his friends after Bilbo's departure from the Shire. Takes place just before and after the Long-Expected Party (S.R. 1401). Bookverse mainly, no slash, only fluff. My intention is to make readers cry. Let me know if it works!

It came in fragments, glimpses, shades of grey. There was a wide land under a growing shadow as darkness rose like a wave—like the wave that had crushed Númenor, that she dreamed of so often—like great dark wings of some fell creature, like the darkness was a thing in itself and not merely the absence of light.
"This village is too crowded, Aragorn. I fear we will lose the hobbits."

Tíniel, daughter of a Khandi chief, is forced to leave her home when a wizard recites a foreboding prophecy. A pirate ship, a near miss with torture, and a few scary dreams later, she finds herself travelling North in the search for answers. What do the Valar want from her? Who is the man she sees in her dreams? And how much will she have to lose before she can fulfil her destiny?

The songs of the cones and the talk of the needles filled the forest air. Wind in her veins, stealth in her toes, blaze in her heart, she listened to her soul trees humming. The dark green spruces spoke her language. / Slow romance, based on friendship. Post-LotR. Legolas/OC (female elf)

During a restless night after returning from a long outing in the south, Legolas reflects on how he and his home have changed since the start of the war in Mirkwood, and Thranduil seeks to comfort and motivate his son.
Aragorn gets sick and Legolas, coming from a race that does not know illness, tries to understand what that must be like.

When tragedy strikes, the last thing Legolas wants to do is leave Rivendell and his friends... but when he does, what will he encounter? And will Aragorn be able to save him from it before the elf prince loses more than just his life?

An earthquake rocks Rivendell and the surrounding areas, leaving chaos and heartbreak in its wake. With Elrond on the brink of death, Aragorn runs away, convinced that he is responsible. Legolas must try to find him before the disaster can claim his life as well. Angry townspeople, a flooding river and the forces of nature conspire against them all, leaving no one unscathed...

It was Fuinur's job to deliver messages, but an unlikely cameo from the most unlikely character imaginable leaves the Nazgul unwilling to see his job done, and the Dark Lord confounded. Based on a scrapped idea of Tolkien's. While I can't blame him for my terrible writing, I am blaming him for the inspiration.

None of the princes were married. Legolas has been betrothed to a healer for many years now, waiting for the day when Greenwood was free of the taint so he could marry his bride. But what of the crown-prince, as heir to the throne? It is a sad tale, and one of heartache for Thondir to recall. It was mere days when they would marry before an unfortunate tragedy struck...

A dark elf with a burning hatred for men is terrorizing the countryside around Rivendell. Unfortunately, that elf bears a striking resemblance to Prince Legolas. An innocent visit from Mirkwood to Rivendell lands Legolas in more trouble than he bargained for, but he is not the only one, because when the dark elf's deadly designs become focused on Aragorn, everyone finds themselves

Vignette. A young Aragorn is injured while out with the rangers. With the more seriously wounded demanding all the immediate attention, Elladan and Elrohir make sure their little brother is not forgotten.

It all began innocently with a proposed archery contest, but that all changed when pesky sisters and a rope came into play. The twins go down, come up again, and war is officially declared. For LadyLindariel! (AU)

Celebrían is planning a birthday festival for her husband, Lord Elrond Half-elven. Will it go as planned? What of Glorfindel and Lindir's sing-off? And what of Elladan and Elrohir's gifts for their father? It's sure to be a celebration Elrond won't soon forget. Happy birthday, LadyLindariel!

Sequel to Exile. Legolas and Aragorn venture into the Mines of Moria to help Balin, only to get more than they bargained for. Meanwhile, Mirkwood is falling into darkness. Her only hope ends up resting in the hands of the two people she has scorned, and Legolas & Aragorn will risk more than their lives to save her.
When Aragorn is accused of murder, he and Legolas risk everything, including their lives, to discover the truth. But just how much will justice end up costing?

Aragorn and Legolas are beginning to become friends, but not everyone in Mirkwood looks kindly on this, or upon they young human ranger. When Legolas' life is threatened, Aragorn is the one person available who knows how to save him, but will the others listen to him before it is too late?

Aragorn and Legolas meet for the first time. Aragorn is in his early twenties and nearly gets killed when he ignores his adopted father's good advice. Legolas finds him, but must fight the demons of his past in order to help the young human.
Thranduil cannot help but dote on his little elfling, especially when it is now only the two of them. (Mute!Legolas, belongs to 'The Strength of Silence' series).

When 13-year-old Estel is injured, the twins and Elrond remember some other difficult times in their own respective youths and a special gift is given across generations, reminding us that none of us are ever truly alone.

Hurt by the taunts of his young friends, little Aragorn runs away and hides in the forest after breaking his arm, convinced that being adopted means his elven father doesn't really want him. Elrond and his sons must find the youngest member of their family and set things straight.
Young Aragorn has a nightmare and Elrond comforts him. Aragorn discovers that elves sleep with their eyes open.

2nd in Mellon Chronicles When young prince Legolas is sent as an envoy to a neighbouring kingdom, things quickly go from bad to worse when treachery rears its ugly head. There are dangerous and deadly things going on in the seemingly innocent realm of Dorolyn and it is up to Legolas and a mysterious stranger to sort things out before an evil is unleashed upon an unsuspecting land.
Returning from a hunting trip, Legolas comes across an animal in need and makes a serious mistake.

Frodo Baggins, after successfully stealing mushrooms from Farmer Maggot's land, falls asleep at Brandy Hall's pumpkin patch, not knowing that Saradoc Brandybuck was looking out for him. My 300th fanfic on this site! Halloween Fanfic, 2018.
What if Nazgul had the children?
Ithilien Rangers, a brutally wet spring, and Damrod's dice. What could possibly go wrong? A sequel to 'Cool Hand'. Rated K for creative swearing. First in the Teitho Challenge 'Consequences"
In the Houses of Healing, Faramir reflects on what the consequences of defeat might be. Written for the Teitho 'Consequences' challenge.

"I do not want to live in a world where I do not wake up to this lovely smile every day." He leaned forward to kiss her smile. "I cannot imagine a future in which you and I do not belong to one another." He lifted her hand and pressed his lips to the backs of her fingers. "Tell me you will marry me and end my misery now."
"There is little to tell about their stay," says The Hobbit of Bilbo and the Dwarves' visit to Rivendell. But Bilbo made a rather remarkable friend during that time.
*Slash/Complete - Aragorn is having trouble focusing and the Elf is there to help him

Seventy-seven years separated the Battle of the Five Armies and the War of the Ring. Seventy-seven years in which the Dark Lord Sauron returned to his base in Mordor, in which the creature Gollum was caught and interrogated by Gandalf, and in which a most memorable Hobbit named Frodo Baggins was born. However, this is not their story. Bâhukhazâd bridge story.
Arwen visits an aged Faramir
Legolas' struggles with the sea longing, Gimli puts the first part of his oath to sail with Legolas into action and Legolas takes an oath of his own.

Idril was stubborn and honorable to a fault, and if her ultimate choice was to remain in Mordor, who was Talion to deny her? Instead he offers aid where and when he can. Celebrimbor is not so generous, however, and the thoughtless cruelty of his words is more than Talion can bear. Things said in anger cannot be undone, and truth often cuts the deepest wounds...
Faramir and his son make a long-delayed journey to Parth Galen.
Faramir comes home from the war.

King Thranduil made the long journey from Mirkwood to Gondor after receiving a letter from his son, mere weeks after the end of the War of the Ring. The seven months spent apart seemed far longer to both of them, and there is much they have to tell each other.
In which Pippin, predictably, invites trouble. One-shot. Written for a school project, therefore relatively unrevised. I am not Tolkien, and my writing style is nowhere like his.
What do Aragorn and Faramir do on their night off?
On a beautiful spring day Aragorn reflects on what he has lost. T just to be safe
Sam awaits news of Frodo's recovery from the Nazgul wound and encounters Glorfindel

"No matter how old she is, for you she'll always be that little girl you've hold for the first time. But then she grows and you have to let her go, watch her transform into a woman and then give her heart away to a man that isn't you."
Elladan, Elrohir, Legolas, and Aragorn are in the mountains during a terrible cold autumn storm and the sons of Elrond reluctantly stay with some of the Avari
