One of my favourite Spike scenes - s05e22 "The Gift" - drabble
Tara and Spike have a conversation directly after Older and Far Away. References the twisted relationship dynamics of Season 6 Buffy/Spike and Tara/Willow.
It's been five years since Spike and Xander got together and they are celebrating in Puerto Rico.

Spike is chained in the basement at his own behest; Willow is struggling to find a hold on her magic, as well as come to terms with the things she's done. The two of them share a moment of bonding and a conversation about souls, humanity, and their pasts as killers. Set sometime between "Showtime" and "The Killer in Me."
Spike needs sixty kittens before he can get his Order of Aurelius ring back. Xander is going to help.
After the events of Chosen, everyone's ready to sleep for a week. And somehow, Buffy and Faith keep ending up in the same bed.

"I'll find her, wherever she is, tie her up, torture her until she likes me again!" Knowing me, where would that quote from the end of "Lovers Walk" possibly take my mind...Warning: possible non con connotations.

A stolen moment between Buffy and Spike the night before the final battle. We don't carry all of our scars on the outside. Short and sweet Spuffy interlude, set in the "unseen" moment in the basement during Chosen. Inspired by the song "Poison and Wine" by The Civil Wars.
Willow tries to come to terms with Tara's departure. Some short angst from S6 Willow's POV.
After her showdown with the Turok Han, Buffy goes to rescue Spike from the First. A continuation of the last scene in "Showtime."

ONE-SHOT. Buffy had a really difficult night. Giles doesn't know what he can do.
Faith doesn't mind when Buffy lies down to gaze at the stars.

Amy hadn't packed her mother's spellbook when she'd moved in with her dad. It was just there, in the bottom of that box. She'd shoved it into the back of her closet, hoping out of sight would mean out of mind. It hadn't.
Cordelia's thoughts and feelings about that new girl. Set throughout Welcome to the Hellmouth. For Maria. Cordelia/Buffy

Spike has returned from Africa, and he's trying to figure out what to do about that soul of his. Stole the plot - it was too good not to.
"He's surprised by how steady his voice is. His hands are anything but." Giles is determined to make amends for his misspent youth. But how does one make up for murder? Pre-series.
Angel thought he could pull a successful April Fools prank on Spike, and he did. He just didn't expect the kind of revenge prank the bleached wonder would do to him.
Faith has settled down in ways she would once have found laughable. A future fic written for the prompt 'BtVS/AtS, Faith, She never thought she end up a housewife,' at fic promptly.
Spike and Angel never agree on anything except for when they do. Spuffel. Set vaguely sometime post-season eight.

This is part 2 and takes place several months after part 1, "Just Another Slayer". Spike has been sent to England to help Giles deal with a mysterious problem. (Feel free to review!) Everything belongs to Joss Whedon and his associates.
When it comes to Tara, Willow thinks rules don't matter.

Nikki Summers is known as the bad girl everywhere she went, she has that I don't give a f**k attitude that people envied. Defying the rules she did what she wanted when she wanted. She lived her life with no rules. That was until she moves to Sunnydale to be with her twin sister Buffy now instead of causing trouble, trouble finds her.
"Demon or not, I still think you're a freak." Missing scene. Set during the events of Family.

After the absurd events of February 29, 2008 were over and done with, no one else working for the New Council besides Faith ever dared to tease the others about yet one more bout of weirdness in the lives of the Scooby Gang.
Travers learns a valuable lesson: never tick off the Slayer's mother...
Takes place after "Something Blue," the consequences of the spell brought something that Buffy and Spike never would have expected.

Faith carries a feeling around her like expecting a roaring, blackening thunderstorm. Or steel hitting against stone, flaring explosive, bright-blinding sparks. Faith loves her cheap, flavorless chapstick and she smells like menthol and sugary, fruity gum. Xander's invited to his bosses wedding. He brings a plus one to the reception.
Spike could never tell where Dru would be next. Spike/Dru. Spuffy. Post-series/season ten.

AU. They've fought vampires and demons and have even saved the world a time or ten. But they've never faced a challenge like this. Will they be strong enough to survive when they see what people can do to each other?
